title: Placement 12th criteria
content: During placements does the 12 th marks really matter if somebody has score around 57 percent in pcm and 65 percent overall subject and does the company look for pcm or overall ?

comments.body: Some companies have have a criteria, that ur 10th and 12th marks should be above 90 percentage. They take into account the overall score.
companies keep over 90 isn't the max they usually go for 75?
10th and 12th avg to be 90 or both should be 90+
Very few, probably a handful, have the 90% requirement.
What's the minimum criteria for majority of companies ?and is it aggregate in all five subject or just pcm ?
Bruh so only 90 percent and above will get placements ? ðŸ˜‚
Well thatâ€™s what Iâ€™m askingâ€¦ someone said 90%
90% in both 10,12 or the avergae of them should be 90??
its usually 60 or 75 sometimes 90
even for 10th? why do they go so far back. i got like 75% in 10th, but above 90 in 12th. will it haunt me forever lmao
Majority donâ€™t ask for 10,12th grades but Iâ€™ve seen few(mostly in single digits) short listing based on 10,12th marks where they keep 90% as cutoff
So they don't ask for 10 th 12th grades ? If somebody has overall 66.8 percent in 12 will he cross any problem during placements if he perform good in college ?
99% of the companies wonâ€™t ask, only a few (mostly in single digits) will shortlist
So the guy won't face any problem with 66 percent in 12th during placements right ?
95% of companies donâ€™t ask or care about your 12th score
So he will be allowed to sit for placements right ?
He will be allowed to sit for placements
Mine is 58% percentage in puc am i eligible??
and those 90%+ companies ask for 90% in aggregate or pcm?
Only a handful of them asked and it was 80/90% overall

got 89.2%, so was just wondering if it's worth getting it re-evaluated.  
Anyway, thanks!
Bro donâ€™t worry too much, itâ€™s hardly a few companies who ask for it like 2-4 at max, donâ€™t worry too much, theyâ€™ll be hundreds more
